questions.text: Which of the following is not a standard condition?
Which is the equivalent to the formation of carbon dioxide?

15 g of octane is burned and used to heat 50 cm³ of water by 15 °C. What is the amount of energy transferred to the water? Assume water density of 1 g cm⁻³ and a specific heat capacity of 4.18 J g⁻¹ K⁻¹.
Which does not increase rate by affecting the number or nature of collisions?
What is the meaning of a heterogeneous catalyst?
questions.choiceA: A: A catalyst which stays the same throughout the reaction.
questions.choiceB: B: A catalyst which changes throughout the reaction.
questions.choiceC: C: A catalyst in the same state as the reactants.
questions.choiceD: D: A catalyst in a different state to the reactants.

questions.text: Which does not describe a reaction at equilibrium?
questions.choiceA: A: Forward and backward reactions occur at equal rate.
questions.choiceB: B: The system must be closed.
questions.choiceC: C: Kc increases as the reaction progresses.
questions.choiceD: D: Concentrations of reactants and products are constant.

questions.text: The energy associated with a photon of electromagnetic radiation is
questions.choiceC: C: inversely proportional to the frequency
questions.choiceD: D: proportional to the square of the frequency
